thread.title: Hilarious animal tourist encounters | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Hilarious animal tourist encounters | Daily Mail Online

author: Annabel Fenwick Elliott For Mailonline
title: Hilarious animal tourist encounters | Daily Mail Online
text: 285 shares Swans are known to become suddenly aggressive, a lesson this gentleman is learning first-hand A baby elephant getting overly playful with a tourist, so much so that it knocks her right over The comedy in this snap is only elevated by the ostrich's wide grin as he scares the living daylights out of a woman in a car The moose appears rather composed in its galloping stance - more than can be said for the ranger it's chasing A cow had a good old nibble on this man's ear and he attempts to pose for a farm selfie This woman was paddling down a river in North America with some friends when a particularly daring raccoon crashed the party All things considered, this young boy is demonstrating quite a brave stance in the face of such a gigantic spider. Many others would be running for the hills This tourist even appears amused by the prospect of having a furious monkey on his shoulder, captured at the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary in Ubud, Indonesia A hiker who was clearly not on board when an alpaca crashed her photo opportunity at Peru's Machu Picchu An elephant gets very curious with its trunk, at the expense of this woman's face An entire troop of baboons pillaged this car's roof case, yanked off the wing mirror, and clearly caused great distress to the woman inside Arguably the most famous of them all, this sees tourist trio Sarah Bourland, Natalie Zaysoff and Kendall Harlanin the Cayman Islands, horrified by a surprise hug from a stingray in 2012 Share or comment on this article 285
